title: Aussie tourists stranded on remote island due to civil war | ABC NEWS
description: Clashes between Saudi and Emirati-backed forces in Yemenâ€™s civil war have left more than 400 tourists stranded on a remote island in the Indian Ocean.    Australians are among the affected foreigners scrambling to book spots on repatriation flights from Socotra through Saudi Arabia.   The current crisis broke out when Riyadh launched air strikes against the Southern Transition Council (STC) in support of Yemeni government forces. The Department of Foreign Affairs is warning Australian passport holders against travelling to Yemen including Socotra.  By Matthew Doran for ABC International. title: Orthodox Christmas celebrations unfold across the globe | The World | ABC NEWS
description: While most of the world has Christmas well and truly in their rearview, some Christian communities have only now marked their holiest day of the year. title: Is Nicolas Maduro's downfall a blow to Venezuela's top ally, China?  | The World | ABC News
description: China has been among the most vocal critics of the us operation to seize Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro and his wife from Caracas - demanding the pair be released immediately. Beijing has been a key backer of the Maduro regime, investing tens of billions in the oil-rich country. But where do events of the past few days leave China's ambitions and influence in Latin America. Eric Olander, editor-in-chief of the China Global South Project spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about what Maduro's downfall means for Beijing's ambitions in the region. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Australia set to roast through nationwide heatwave | ABC NEWS
description: Southern Australia will collectively bake this week through the most intense spell of heat in years as temperatures soar up to 15 degrees Celsius above the mid-summer average.  At its peak, daytime maximums will hit the mid-40s across multiple days in a broad stretch of the country from northern WA to the south-east inland â€” coming within a few degrees of all-time records.  However, milder coastal regions will also sweat through sweltering temperatures, peaking at 44C in Western Sydney, 44C across northern Adelaide, and 42C in Melbourne.  Exceptionally muggy nights will accompany the hot days to produce oppressive conditions, which, combined with the longevity of the event, has triggered a severe-to-extreme heatwave warning across the majority of SA, Victoria, and NSW.  Video by Luke Radford and David Douglas Stuart for the ABC News Social Media Team.  To personalise your news & stay in the know, download the ABC News app through your app store.
